title: Snowflake’s CEO explains the company’s high-stakes AI bet
summary:
- After a challenging few years, Snowflake's CEO Sridhar Ramaswamy is steering the company with a strong focus on AI partnerships, notably with OpenAI and Anthropic.
- Snowflake claims to hold crucial data for over 700 Global 2000 companies, asserting its position as a leading data and AI company.
- Ramaswamy emphasizes the importance of focusing on impactful elements within the business environment while recognizing external uncertainties affecting the market.

sources.title: Snowflake’s CEO explains the company’s high-stakes AI bet

title: Roblox Enhances Parental Controls for Child Safety
summary:
- Roblox introduces new parental controls allowing parents to block users on their child's friends list.
- Parents can restrict access to specific games and experiences.
- Children under 13 cannot unblock content blocked by parents without a request.
- A feature allows parents to view the 20 most frequented experiences by their children weekly.
- New tools are available for parents who verify identity with ID or credit card.
- Updates focus on friend management, content maturity control, and screen-time insights.
- Compliance with new regulations under the Online Safety Act is emphasized.
- Roblox has faced issues regarding bullying and inappropriate content, particularly affecting users aged 8 to 12.
- Roblox’s chief safety officer reaffirms commitment to user safety.
- In 2024, Roblox had over 80 million daily players, 40% of whom are under 13.
- Previous updates included preventing direct messaging for users under 13.
- Ongoing concerns exist about harmful content despite implemented safety measures.

sources.title: Roblox will let parents block people on their child’s friends list
Roblox gives parents more power over children’s activity on gaming platform

title: Samsung’s Tab S10 FE tablets arrive with a $50 price hike
summary:
- Samsung launches the Tab S10 FE and Tab S10 FE Plus with a $50 price increase over predecessors.
- The Tab S10 FE has a 10.9-inch screen, while the FE Plus has a new 13.1-inch display.
- Both tablets feature LCD panels, 90Hz refresh rates, and run on Android 15.
- They are powered by the Exynos 1580 chipset, with options for up to 12GB RAM and 256GB storage.
- Available from April 10th; the Tab S10 FE starts at $499.99 and the FE Plus at $649.99, with a 5G version for an additional $100.

sources.title: Samsung’s Tab S10 FE tablets arrive with a $50 price hike

title: Everything revealed during the Nintendo Switch 2 Direct
summary:
- Nintendo to reveal more on the Switch 2 during a Direct on April 2nd at 9 AM ET.
- The console will have backward compatibility and allow digital game transfers via a new virtual game card system.
- Speculations about a new “C” button on Joy-Con controllers and mouse functionality.
- New games such as a Mario Kart title confirmed; expected cross-gen releases include Metroid Prime 4 and Pokémon Legends: Z-A.
- Direct to provide detailed insights into the console and its features.

sources.title: Everything revealed during the Nintendo Switch 2 Direct

title: Vapes aren’t just for smoking anymore—now they’re digital toys
summary:
- Vaping devices are evolving into digital gadgets, appealing to teens.
- New designs mimic video games and smartphones, creating a gamified addiction experience.
- Research indicates vaping harms cardiovascular and respiratory health and can lead to nicotine dependency.
- Many new vape products are unregulated and often smuggled, increasing their health risks and appeal to children.

sources.title: Vapes aren’t just for smoking anymore—now they’re digital toys

title: Micro USB is the bane of my existence
summary:
* The author expresses frustration with the continued use of Micro USB ports in gadgets after USB-C became mainstream.
* USB-C was introduced in 2014, yet many devices still rely on Micro USB, including recent tech products.
* The European Union has mandated that all new devices sold in the EU must support USB-C charging to reduce e-waste.
* The regulation applies to various devices but still allows for proprietary chargers, complicating the transition away from Micro USB.
* Adoption of USB-C is improving and is expected to continue, but consumers still face challenges with existing Micro USB products.

sources.title: Micro USB is the bane of my existence

title: Underground trading of malicious LLMs is fueling cybercrime
summary:
- The rise of AI-generated scams is leading to increased cybercrime, with myriad attacks being reported.
- Victims are deceived by tailored messages that appear highly personalized, making it difficult to differentiate between legitimate communications and scams.
- One victim, George Wilson, lost several thousand dollars through a phishing attack in November 2024 that used convincing dialogue to manipulate his trust.

sources.title: Underground trading of malicious LLMs is fueling cybercrime

title: A16z said to consider TikTok investment as part of Oracle-led bid
summary:
- A16z is reportedly considering an investment in TikTok.
- This potential investment is part of a broader Oracle-led bid.
- The news indicates increasing interest in TikTok despite regulatory concerns.

sources.title: A16z said to consider TikTok investment as part of Oracle-led bid

title: The Rise of Microdramas: From China to Southeast Asia
summary:
- Chinese microdramas are gaining popularity and may expand to Southeast Asia.
- These short dramas often feature episodes lasting around 15 minutes.
- Local adaptations of Chinese microdramas could attract viewers in Southeast Asian countries.
- Microdramas, short vertical videos, are rapidly growing in popularity and revenue in China, even surpassing box office films in earnings.
- The format's success lies in its convenience with short episodes featuring engaging cliffhangers.
- Southeast Asian companies are beginning to produce original microdramas, but may face tough competition from established Chinese producers.

sources.title: China’s hooked on microdramas. Will Southeast Asia tune in?
The 3-minute shows making billions

title: What is AI thinking? Anthropic researchers are starting to figure it out
summary:
- Anthropic researchers investigate how AI models understand complex ideas and generate responses.
- A new tool developed serves as an “AI microscope” to analyze information flows within a large language model (LLM).
- The study reveals that AI approaches problems, such as arithmetic, differently than humans by using logic and probabilistic methods.
- Researchers explore whether LLMs think in universal concepts or the specific languages used in prompts.

sources.title: What is AI thinking? Anthropic researchers are starting to figure it out

title: Valve fixes Steam Deck update that caused boot loops
summary:
- Valve issued a corrective update for the Steam client on Steam Decks after previous update caused boot loops.
- The problematic update was released on April 1st, following a SteamOS update on March 31st.
- Users reported issues with boot loops and missing GPU clock speed settings through Reddit and GitHub.
- Valve re-released the client update to fix these issues and also released updates to the beta channel for the same problems.

sources.title: Valve fixes Steam Deck update that caused boot loops

title: Meet the 50 top-funded startups and tech companies in Singapore + 50 rising startups in Singapore
summary:
- Lists top 50 startups and tech companies in Singapore that have raised funding in the past two years.
- Entries feature key details regarding funding rounds, up to Series E stage.
- Based on data from [Tech in Asia](https://www.techinasia.com/top-funded-startups-tech-companies-singapore).
- Access to the full article requires a subscription as it is premium content.

sources.title: 50 rising startups in Singapore
Meet the 50 top-funded startups and tech companies in Singapore

title: AC Ventures sells 6.5% of GCash to Mitsubishi for $321.5m
summary:
- The Philippines’ Ayala Corp. sold 6.5% of GCash to Japan’s Mitsubishi Corp for 18.4 billion pesos (around US$321.5 million).
- AC Ventures holds a 13% stake in Mynt, which operates GCash.
- Mitsubishi also acquires 18 million common and redeemable preferred shares of AC Ventures.
- Post-transaction, Ayala and Mitsubishi will each own 50% of AC Ventures.

sources.title: AC Ventures sells 6.5% of GCash to Mitsubishi for $321.5m

title: UK and Australian Authors Demand Action Against Meta for AI Copyright Violations
summary:
- Australian authors express anger over alleged use of their works in Meta's AI training dataset, LibGen.
- Authors like Ta-Nehisi Coates and Sarah Silverman are involved in lawsuits against Meta for copyright infringement.
- The Atlantic offers a searchable database for authors to check if their works are in LibGen.
- Advocates, including Holden Sheppard and Tracey Spicer, call for legal action and government intervention.
- The Australian Society of Authors encourages affected writers to voice their concerns, while Meta remains silent on the issue.
- A group of authors, including Richard Osman and Kazuo Ishiguro, are pushing the UK government to hold Meta accountable for alleged copyright infringements.
- The Society of Authors has organized an open letter published as a petition on Change.org, urging Culture Secretary Lisa Nandy to summon Meta executives.
- The authors allege Meta used works from LibGen, a shadow library, without permission, claiming it could severely impact UK writers.
- Meta has denied the allegations, stating that its AI models operate under fair use of copyrighted material.

sources.title: Australian authors outraged over Meta’s AI using their books
UK authors push for action against Meta over AI copyright use

title: Trump to consider final proposal on TikTok future as US ban deadline looms
summary:
- Donald Trump is set to review a final proposal regarding TikTok before the deadline for a sale to a non-Chinese buyer.
- Key officials, including US vice-president JD Vance and commerce secretary Howard Lutnick, will meet to discuss TikTok’s future.
- Trump indicated that a deal with ByteDance, the parent company of TikTok, should be finalized before Saturday's deadline.
- The proposed deal involves significant investment from firms like Andreessen Horowitz and Blackstone to increase non-Chinese ownership of TikTok.
- A US ban on TikTok is poised to take effect due to national security concerns unless a sale occurs.

sources.title: Trump to consider final proposal on TikTok future as US ban deadline looms

title: China launches plan to boost financial services for tech firms
summary:
- China has announced a new plan to enhance financial services for technology-driven enterprises.
- The initiative integrates advancements in technology and industry to improve financial support mechanisms.
- It aims to create a multi-level technology financial service ecosystem involving various stakeholders.
- The plan focuses on enhancing credit and insurance services for tech firms and promoting bond financing.
- Financial institutions are encouraged to adopt technologies like cloud computing and AI for better risk management.
- Differentiated evaluation systems will be introduced to improve financing guarantees for tech businesses.

sources.title: China launches plan to boost financial services for tech firms

title: Tesla’s stock falls 36% as Musk’s political role affects sales
summary:
- Tesla’s stock dropped 36% in Q1 2025, losing over $460 billion in market capitalization.
- The decline is linked to CEO Elon Musk’s role in Trump’s second administration, leading the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), causing protests and boycotts against Tesla.
- Tesla faces challenges with declining vehicle sales and skepticism about Musk’s promised driverless ride-hailing service by June in Austin, Texas.
- Analysts express doubt regarding Tesla's ability to fulfill deadlines for Full Self-Driving software and hardware upgrades.
- Musk describes the situation as a “buying opportunity” for investors.

sources.title: Tesla’s stock falls 36% as Musk’s political role affects sales

title: OpenAI faces $10b funding cut unless it goes for-profit
summary:
- OpenAI's private funding round, currently valued at $40 billion, may drop by $10 billion unless it converts to a for-profit entity by December 31.
- SoftBank's investment would decrease from $30 billion to $20 billion; Microsoft and others expected to maintain $10 billion commitments.
- OpenAI's valuation could reach $300 billion with incoming capital; restructuring needs approval from Microsoft and California Attorney General.
- Legal challenges add complexity, including a case from co-founder Elon Musk.
- Financing includes convertible notes turning into equity post-restructuring; part will fund Stargate venture with SoftBank and Oracle.
- CEO Sam Altman focuses on research while COO Brad Lightcap expands business operations; revenue projected to triple to $12.7 billion by 2025.

sources.title: OpenAI faces $10b funding cut unless it goes for-profit

title: UK needs to relax AI laws or risk transatlantic ties, thinktank warns
summary:
- Tony Blair’s thinktank urges UK to relax copyright laws for AI firms to innovate.
- Strict copyright measures could strain UK-US relations as US plans to announce tariffs on UK goods.
- The report states UK privacy laws must align with US policies to avoid pushing AI development abroad.
- TBI supports proposals allowing AI training on copyright-protected material without permission unless creators opt out.
- Warns UK could weaken its position in the AI race if it enforces overly restrictive laws compared to the EU, Japan, or Singapore.
- Calls for the establishment of a Centre for AI and Creative Industries to bridge the gap between tech and creative sectors.
- Criticism from campaigners about potential conflicts of interest due to TBI’s funding from US tech billionaire Larry Ellison.

sources.title: UK needs to relax AI laws or risk transatlantic ties, thinktank warns

title: US court allows most of New York Times’ AI lawsuit to proceed
summary:
- A US District Court judge allows most of the New York Times’ lawsuit against OpenAI and Microsoft to proceed.
- The lawsuit, filed in late 2023, claims copyright infringement for using Times’ content to train AI models.
- Judge Sidney Stein rejected motions to dismiss related to indirect liability and older copyrighted works, but partially dismissed claims on copyright management information.
- The case represents a significant legal challenge by a news publisher against AI companies, with other publishers joining the lawsuit.
- The ruling occurs amid debates on whether AI's use of publicly available data qualifies as "fair use"; a court decision on a jury trial will follow discovery.

sources.title: US court allows most of New York Times’ AI lawsuit to proceed

title: Amazon resumes Prime Air drone deliveries after 2-month pause
summary:
- Amazon has restarted Prime Air drone deliveries in Texas and Arizona after a two-month suspension.
- Deliveries were halted due to altitude sensor issues caused by dust; no safety incidents reported.
- A software update has been approved by the FAA to resume operations.
- The MK30 drone model, designed to be quieter and capable of flying in light rain, is being used.
- Noise complaints have led to plans to relocate the drone hub in College Station.
- Amazon aims to deliver 500 million packages by drone annually by 2030 despite challenges faced in drone development.

sources.title: Amazon resumes Prime Air drone deliveries after 2-month pause

title: Australian Retail Tech Startup Flagship Secures $3.75M in Seed Funding
summary:
- Australian startup Flagship raises $3.75 million in seed funding to enhance retail technology solutions.
- Investors include leading venture capital firms and angel investors.
- Funding aims to improve the shopping experience through innovative tech.
- Debt financing is on the rise among tech companies in Southeast Asia and India.
- Significant funding trends include a projection of $1.8 billion in new investment vehicles by 2025.
- Daphni closed a €200 million fund and aims to invest in 40 startups.
- Fisdom reduces FY24 net loss by 19% and anticipates EBITDA profitability by March FY24.
- Founders face rising funding challenges, with less than 1% securing necessary investment.

summary:
- CaaStle, a US clothing startup, is facing potential collapse due to fraud allegations.
- These allegations could jeopardize the business model that CaaStle relies on.
- The company has not provided a public statement addressing the issue directly.

title: ByteDance founder denies acquiring Singapore citizenship
summary:
- ByteDance’s founder Zhang Yiming denied reports of obtaining Singaporean citizenship.
- The claim emerged from a report published on Apr. 1 by Singapore’s Lianhe Zaobao, but was retracted by Apr. 2.
- Citizenship acquisition would require renouncing Chinese citizenship under China’s nationality law.
- Zhang maintains a significant role at ByteDance despite stepping back from corporate duties and is known to spend considerable time in Singapore.

sources.title: ByteDance founder denies acquiring Singapore citizenship

title: Asia prepares for Trump’s ‘Liberation Day’ tariffs
summary:
- President Trump will announce new tariffs on April 2 at 4 pm ET in the White House Rose Garden, termed "Liberation Day."
- Aimed at addressing perceived unfair trade practices, Asian countries like Vietnam, India, and Japan are bracing for economic fallout.
- Vietnam plans to reduce import duties on cars and food, while India considers tax cuts on agricultural products.
- Trump has previously imposed tariffs on Chinese goods, steel, aluminum, and auto imports.
- Specifics of the tariffs are unclear, but Trump hinted they might target "all countries."
- US allies like Japan and South Korea are preparing to support their industries; Japan's automaking sector is notably at risk.
- Asian companies are increasing US investments to reduce risks, including Honda’s $300 million investment in Ohio and TSMC’s $100 billion expansion.

sources.title: Asia prepares for Trump’s ‘Liberation Day’ tariffs

title: Japan’s Metaplanet Expands Bitcoin Holdings with $12.6 Million Acquisition
summary:
- Japanese investment firm Metaplanet purchased 160 BTC for approximately US$13.3 million.
- Total holdings reached 4,206 BTC, valued at around US$356.2 million.
- Metaplanet has invested a total of US$359.8 million in bitcoin since April 2024.
- The firm aims to reach 10,000 BTC by the end of 2025 and 21,000 BTC by 2026.
- Q1 2025 operating revenue was 770.35 million yen (US$5.2 million), an 11.4% increase from Q4 2024.
- Stock price fell by 0.98%, while bitcoin's price rose by 1.6% to US$84,526.

title: US video game retailer GameStop raises $1.5b to buy BTC
summary:
- GameStop has raised $1.5 billion through a private offering of 0.00% convertible senior notes due in 2030, including an additional $200 million in notes.
- The funds will be used to purchase bitcoin, following a strategy similar to MicroStrategy’s.
- Initially boosted GameStop’s stock, but shares have since declined, indicating mixed investor reactions.
- The company currently holds over $4 billion in cash and reported $3.8 billion in revenue in 2024, supporting further bitcoin acquisitions according to Nathan Cox, chief investment officer of Two Prime Digital Assets.
- Recent developments include a jump of 12% in stock on March 27, 2025, following bitcoin investment, despite a 30% drop in sales.

summary:

- Southeast Asia's digital economy reached US$263 billion in 2024, with growing sectors like ecommerce and fintech.
- Indian startups raised US$3.1 billion across 232 deals in Q1 2025, a 41% increase year-on-year.
- Late-stage startups saw nearly 80% growth, with key funding rounds for Innovaccer, Zolve, and DarwinBox.
- Fintech led funding with US$739 million, followed by ecommerce at US$610 million.
- M&A activity rose 73% year-on-year, including Hindustan Unilever’s acquisition of Minimalist.

title: Motorola’s first Edge 60 phone feels like canvas
summary:
- Motorola announces the Edge 60 Fusion, priced at £299.99 (around $390).
- The phone features a unique faux-canvas finish, available only in the teal version, with other colors in faux leather.
- It has IP68 and 69 ratings for dust and water resistance.
- The device is slim, under 8mm thick, with a 5,200mAh battery and a 6.67-inch OLED screen.
- RAM options up to 12GB and storage up to 512GB are available, using a MediaTek Dimensity chipset (7300 or 7400).
- Camera setup includes a 50MP main lens and a 13MP ultrawide, but limited to four sensors accounting for flash and flicker sensor.
- Expected to be first of the Edge 60 series, with previous models not launched in the US.

sources.title: Motorola’s first Edge 60 phone feels like canvas

title: Circle paid $210m to acquire Coinbase’s stake, IPO filing reveals
summary:
- Circle purchased Coinbase's 50% stake in Centre Consortium for $210 million in shares in 2023, becoming the sole issuer of the USDC stablecoin.
- The acquisition involved about 8.4 million common shares of Circle, worth approximately $209.9 million.
- Following the acquisition, Centre Consortium was made an indirect subsidiary of Circle and was dissolved in December 2023, with its net assets transferred to another Circle subsidiary.

sources.title: Circle paid $210m to acquire Coinbase’s stake, IPO filing reveals

title: Coinbase shares drop 30% due to US economic concerns
summary:
- Coinbase's stock has dropped over 30%, its worst performance since the FTX collapse in late 2022.
- Economic uncertainty, including recession fears and trade tensions, is driving market unease.
- The S&P 500 Index is on track for its worst quarter since mid-2022, prompting traders to move away from riskier assets like cryptocurrencies.
- Oppenheimer analyst Owen Lau cites macroeconomic factors as reasons for the decline in crypto stocks, which are more volatile than Bitcoin.

sources.title: Coinbase shares drop 30% due to US economic concerns

title: Tether acquires 8,888 bitcoins, raising holdings to $7.8b
summary:
- Tether acquired 8,888 bitcoin for US$735 million in Q1 2025, increasing total holdings to 92,646 BTC valued at about US$7.8 billion.
- The company has been accumulating bitcoin since September 2022, allocating 15% of quarterly net profits for this purpose.
- Despite a nearly 12% drop in bitcoin prices in Q1 2025, Tether's unrealized gains on its reserves amount to approximately US$3.86 billion.

sources.title: Tether acquires 8,888 bitcoins, raising holdings to $7.8b

title: Trump Optimistic About Final TikTok Deal Before April 5 Deadline
summary:
- President Donald Trump believes a deal for TikTok's sale may be completed before the April 5 deadline.
- The deadline requires TikTok to secure a non-Chinese buyer due to national security concerns.
- Potential buyers for TikTok's US operations include **Blackstone** and **Oracle**.
- Trump will review TikTok's final proposal on **April 2**.
- TikTok’s parent company, **ByteDance**, must divest by **April 5** to avoid a US ban.
- The deadline was extended from an original date of **January 19** by Trump’s executive order.
- High interest from potential buyers has been acknowledged by Trump.

sources.title: Trump optimistic about TikTok deal before deadline
Trump to review final TikTok proposal on Apr. 2

title: China's Guangdong Province Launches AI and Robotics Hub, Tencent and Alibaba Introduce AI Tools for Farming
summary:
- Rural communities in China are adopting AI for farming, pest control, and ecommerce due to increased internet access and mobile phone usage.
- Tencent and Alibaba are at the forefront of this transition, offering tools like Tencent’s chatbot Yuanbao and Alibaba’s Tongyi for various agricultural needs.
- A village chief in Jiaohe, Jilin, implemented AI tools for farming advice, livestock management, and online promotions in collaboration with Tencent.
- Tencent's "AI Goes Rural" program aims to make AI solutions more relevant for rural areas, working alongside local officials.
- Alibaba's partnership with the Zhejiang provincial government focuses on integrating AI to tackle rural challenges.
- On Apr. 1, Guangdong provincial government launched an initiative for an AI and robotics hub.
- The plan includes subsidies of up to 50 million yuan (US$6.88 million) for manufacturing innovation hubs.
- Individual companies can receive up to 3 million yuan (US$412,662).
- Up to five open-source communities and ten large language model use cases will receive annual funding of up to 8 million yuan (US$1.1 million).
- Local tech firms like Huawei and Tencent are contributing to the initiative.
- This initiative aims to position Guangdong as a global leader in AI and robotics, following similar successes in other provinces like Zhejiang.

sources.title: Tencent, Alibaba introduce AI tools for farming in rural China
China’s Guangdong province launches AI, robotics hub

title: Ex-Uber execs’ marketplace firm nets $5m series A
summary:
- Evenflow, a marketplace aggregator founded by ex-Uber executives, has raised $5 million in Series A funding.
- The funding was led by Venture Catalysts and Dr. Reddy’s Laboratories' Sunder Ramachandran, along with angel investors.
- The company aims to expand operations and improve profitability across its portfolio of brands including Xtrim, Yogarise, Rusabl, BabyPro, and Trendy Homes.
- To date, Evenflow has raised nearly $14 million since its founding in 2021.

sources.title: Ex-Uber execs’ marketplace firm nets $5m series A

title: 9gag co-founder leads Asia’s first public virtual asset hub
summary:
- Ray Chan, co-founder of 9gag, acquires a controlling stake in Howking Technology International Holdings Limited.
- The company will be renamed MemeStrategy Inc. pending shareholder approval.
- Chan to serve as chairman and CEO, with board members from 9gag and Memeland.
- MemeStrategy plans to integrate bitcoin and other virtual assets and invest in Web3 and AI.
- Will leverage 9gag’s community of over 200 million users for growth.
- Initiatives include “Creator Economy 4.0” and the “Decentralized Physical Infrastructure Network” (DePin).
- Aims to establish itself as Asia’s first publicly listed virtual asset ecosystem and contribute to Hong Kong’s virtual assets hub.

sources.title: 9gag co-founder leads Asia’s first public virtual asset hub

title: Douyin launches website to explain algorithm transparency
summary:
- Douyin, the Chinese version of TikTok, has launched a website dedicated to explaining its algorithm transparency.
- The initiative aims to provide users with insights into how content is recommended and curated on the platform.
- This move responds to growing concerns over data privacy and the need for transparency in social media algorithms.

sources.title: Douyin launches website to explain algorithm transparency

title: Visa proposes $100m deal for Apple card partnership
summary:
- Visa has proposed a $100 million deal to become Apple’s credit card network partner.
- The offer includes an upfront payment typically associated with major card programs.
- Competitor American Express also aims to secure the Apple Card, seeking to serve as both issuer and network.
- Apple’s previous partnership with Goldman Sachs and Mastercard ended in November 2023.
- Other financial institutions discussing the partnership include Barclays, Synchrony Financial, and JPMorgan Chase.
- Visa declined to comment on the proposal when contacted by Reuters.

sources.title: Visa proposes $100m deal for Apple card partnership

title: Japan’s new app law limits Google search, Apple store power
summary:
- Japan’s Fair Trade Commission has enacted a new law to regulate major IT firms such as Google and Apple.
- The law, titled the Act on Promotion of Competition for Specified Smartphone Software, was enacted in June 2024.
- It targets companies with over 40 million monthly users, limiting practices that reduce alternatives in app stores and search engines.
- Regulations restrict app store practices that block third-party stores and alternative payment systems.
- The law also limits Google’s search engine, preventing unfair prioritization of its own services.
- Detailed guidelines for the law’s implementation are expected by December 2025.

sources.title: Japan’s new app law limits Google search, Apple store power

title: Japan’s Rapidus to begin 2-nanometer chip production by April
summary:
- The Japanese government has announced an additional 800 billion yen (US$5.4 billion) for Rapidus, increasing total support to US$11.5 billion.
- Rapidus plans to mass-produce advanced 2-nanometer chips, with prototype production starting in April at its Hokkaido facility.
- The funding will assist in acquiring equipment, raw materials, and implementing production technologies.
- Japan's industry ministry confirmed the funds aim to strengthen Rapidus’ production capabilities.
- A proposed bill could make the government a shareholder in Rapidus and allocate an additional 100 billion yen (US$668 million) if passed.
- Japan-based semiconductor company Rapidus will begin operations at its 2-nanometer semiconductor facility in Hokkaido this month.
- A prototype chip is expected by July, according to CEO Koike Atsuyoshi.
- Producing 2-nanometer chips involves nearly 300 complex production steps.
- Mass production is planned to commence by 2027, with a phased approach to optimize yield rates and build customer confidence.

sources.title: Japan boosts funding by $5.4b for Rapidus advanced chip push
Japan’s Rapidus to begin 2-nanometer chip production by April

title: SG investment manager launches $357m digital infra fund in China
summary:
- Singapore-based investment manager GLP launches the GLP China IDC Income Fund I with $357.76 million in assets.
- The fund will acquire an operational data center in the Greater Beijing region, leased to a major ecommerce company.
- This initiative responds to the rising global demand for data centers, expected to triple in the next three years, consuming significant energy resources.

sources.title: SG investment manager launches $357m digital infra fund in China

title: Google Makes Email Encryption Easier for Businesses
summary:
- Google updates Gmail to enable enterprise users to send encrypted emails to any inbox.
- New encryption model allows secure messaging without custom software or encryption certificates.
- Feature is rolling out in beta, expected to be available for all Gmail users soon.
- Non-Gmail users will receive a link to view and reply to encrypted messages.
- The encryption process is more advanced than standard Transport Layer Security but not end-to-end encryption.
- Initial feature allows encrypted emails within organizations, with future plans for all Gmail users and third-party providers.
- New system replaces S/MIME protocol; users can enable additional encryption in email draft window.
- Recipients without S/MIME access messages via a guest Google Workspace account; those with S/MIME use the existing protocol.
- Client-side encryption offers stronger protection than default TLS, with workspace admins managing keys and monitoring files.

sources.title: Gmail is making it easier for businesses to send encrypted emails to anyone
Google streamlines Gmail email encryption for businesses

title: VN startup banks on co-ops to defy agritech skeptics
summary:
- Vietnam-based agritech firm TechCoop raised US$70 million in series A funding.
- The startup, founded by Hao Diep in 2022, focuses on trade credit financing for farming cooperatives.
- TechCoop projects annualized revenue of US$250 million by 2025 and US$400 million by 2026.
- The company partners with banks to offer financing for cooperatives, tracking and verifying transactions on its platform.
- Unlike traditional lending, TechCoop does not charge interest but makes gross margins from buying and selling agricultural products.

sources.title: VN startup banks on co-ops to defy agritech skeptics

title: ZTE appoints new chairman as it shifts to AI strategy
summary:
- ZTE Corp appoints Fang Rong as new chairman, succeeding Li Zixue.
- Fang will collaborate with CEO Xu Ziyang in management.
- The company is transitioning to focus on AI to combat declining revenue in the carrier network business.
- ZTE aims to transform into a "connectivity plus computing" enterprise by 2025.
- Following the announcement, ZTE's stock prices rose slightly, with Hong Kong shares increasing by 1.89%.

sources.title: ZTE appoints new chairman as it shifts to AI strategy

title: Apple AI Expands with Korean Support and Enhanced Features
summary:
- Apple updated its website regarding the use of Look Around imagery for AI training on March 2025.
- Images collected will enhance products and services related to image recognition, creation, and enhancement.
- Look Around uses vehicles and backpacks to collect images and 3D data, ensuring privacy by blurring faces and license plates.
- Apple adds Korean-language support to its AI system, Apple Intelligence, which now also includes French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish, Japanese, and Simplified Chinese.
- Features of Apple Intelligence include AI-powered writing tools, photo editing, mail and notification summaries, and voice recording transcription, emphasizing user privacy through on-device processing.
- The update also introduces the "Find My" location tracking feature in Korea, allowing users to track their devices on iPhones, iPads, and Apple Watches after over a decade of unavailability.

title: Taiwan proposes new crypto regulations for local platforms
summary:

- Both proposed regulations require local licensing for crypto platforms and permits for overseas providers to establish entities in Taiwan.
- Huang Shan-shan aims for the draft to be enacted by the end of 2025, with public feedback concluding on May 24 and submission to the Executive Yuan in June.
- This draft follows a failed attempt in 2023 to pass similar regulations, which are expected to raise compliance costs for providers to meet anti-money laundering requirements.
- Non-compliance may lead to fines or imprisonment, with suggestions for a tiered approach for smaller firms to ease regulatory burdens.

title: Qualcomm Acquires Generative AI Division of VinAI
summary:
- Qualcomm has acquired the generative AI division of [VinAI](https://www.vinai.io/our-story/) for an undisclosed amount.
- The acquisition is part of Qualcomm's strategy to expand its AI tooling capabilities.
- VinAI, founded by former DeepMind scientist Hung Bui, focuses on generative AI technologies including computer vision algorithms and language models.
- Hung Bui, VinAI's CEO, will join Qualcomm after the acquisition.
- VinAI employs around 200 people across locations in Hanoi, the U.S., and Australia.
- This acquisition is Qualcomm's second in 2025, following the purchase of Edge Impulse in March.
- The acquisition aims to improve Qualcomm’s R&D in generative AI for smartphones, PCs, and software-defined vehicles.

summary:

summary:

- E-commerce analytics firm AMP raised US$12.7 million in funding in 2025.
- Major funding has been scarce; Ninja Van secured US$50 million credit from HSBC last October.
- Early-stage funding has been noted for greentech logistics firms in the past year.
- A price war is intensifying in Southeast Asia’s logistics sector, especially on ecommerce platforms.
- Shopee's reliance on in-house logistics, SPX Express, poses threats to third-party logistics (3PLs). 
- J&T Express, while successful, may face reduced shipment volumes due to the partnership ending with Shopee in Indonesia.

title: Researchers Suggest OpenAI Trained AI Models on Paywalled O’Reilly Books + US court rules AI art can’t be copyrighted
summary:
- A recent court ruling has determined that art created by artificial intelligence cannot be protected by copyright.
- The case involved a challenge to the copyright eligibility of AI-generated works.
- This decision could have significant implications for the future of copyright law and AI-generated creativity.
- OpenAI is accused of training AI models on copyrighted material without permission, specifically paywalled books from O’Reilly Media.
- A paper from the AI Disclosures Project claims GPT-4o shows strong recognition of non-public O’Reilly content without licensing agreements.
- The study analyzed 13,962 excerpts from O’Reilly books and suggests GPT-4o may have prior knowledge of this content due to its training data practices.
- The methodology used, DE-COP, tests if AI models recognize original text to infer prior exposure during training.
- While the findings are significant, the authors acknowledge the method isn't foolproof and that there may be alternate explanations.

title: Who are climate conscious consumers? Not who you’d expect, says Northwind Climate
summary:
- Northwind Climate identifies a category called "climate doers," who prioritize climate-friendly purchases.
- Surprising characteristic: Many climate doers frequently visit fast food restaurants, and about 30% identify as Republicans.
- Northwind Climate has raised $1.05 million in pre-seed funding, focusing on behavioral insights over demographics.
- The startup categorizes consumers into five groups, including "climate distressed" and "climate deniers."
- Recommendations for EV marketing vary by consumer category, focusing on choice for climate doers and freedom for deniers.
- Northwind's database contains 20,000 respondents, growing by 2,500 each month, offering insights to subscribing companies for a fee.
- The company is developing an AI model to function as a virtual focus group for marketing analysis.

title: How to set up Wi-Fi calling on Android and iPhones

- For Samsung Galaxy: Open Phone app > tap three dots > find Wi-Fi Calling toggle in Quick Settings.
- To set up Wi-Fi calling on iPhone: Go to Settings > Cellular > Wi-Fi Calling, confirm your address for emergency services and enable Wi-Fi Calling.

title: EU may fine Meta up to $16b for violating ad rules + Zuckerberg's Strategy Amid Upcoming EU Fines Against Meta
summary:

- Under the DMA, Meta could face up to $16 billion in penalties based on its 2024 revenue.
- The EU ruling may affect Meta's European revenue, prompting concerns about personalized ads.
- Zuckerberg has publicly criticized EU regulations and enlisted US trade officials' help to contest the fines.
- The EU is set to fine Meta for its 'pay or consent' advertising model on Facebook and Instagram.
- A preliminary ruling found this model violates the Digital Markets Act (DMA).
- The decision follows a July 2024 finding that this model restricts user choice in ad personalization.
- Fines could reach up to 10% of Meta's annual revenue, potentially amounting to $16 billion based on 2024 earnings.
- If enforced, Meta will likely have to allow users to opt out of personalized ads without a fee.
- This may significantly affect Meta's revenue in Europe, which constitutes nearly 25% of its total income.

title: Ola Electric boosts battery, EV charging units with fresh funding
summary:
- Ola Electric secures 199 crore rupees (US$23.3 million) funding for its battery subsidiary, Ola Cell Technologies (OCT).
- The funding will convert 61.2 crore (US$7.2 million) in outstanding payables into compulsory convertible preference shares (CCPS).
- Ola Electric is also investing 3.5 crore rupees (US$410,000) into its charging infrastructure subsidiary, Ola Electric Charging (OEC).

sources.title: Ola Electric boosts battery, EV charging units with fresh funding

title: US-based microservices platform Temporal raises $146m series C
summary:
- Seattle-based Temporal raised US$146 million in Series C funding led by Tiger Global.
- The funding round brings total funding to US$350 million and values the company at US$1.72 billion.
- Temporal specializes in microservices orchestration, aiding businesses in streamlining payment processing and infrastructure management.
- New funds will be allocated for R&D, AI initiatives, cloud services for Azure, and expanding sales and marketing.
- Notable users of Temporal’s platform include Nvidia, Box, Snap, Stripe, and Instacart.

sources.title: US-based microservices platform Temporal raises $146m series C

title: Companies reevaluate DEI initiatives during Trump policies
summary:
- Many US companies are reevaluating their Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) initiatives in response to President Trump’s policies.
- Changes include modifications in hiring practices and employee resource groups.
- Companies like Google and McDonald’s have adjusted their DEI programs to align with the current administration’s stance and to comply with new regulations.

sources.title: Companies reevaluate DEI initiatives during Trump policies

title: Taiwan to rank among top semiconductor equipment spenders
summary:
- Taiwan is projected to be among the top spenders on semiconductor equipment globally.
- The rise in spending is attributed to increasing demand for advanced chips.
- This reflects Taiwan's significant position in the global semiconductor supply chain.

sources.title: Taiwan to rank among top semiconductor equipment spenders

title: CoreWeave's Stock Drops Below IPO Price Following $1.5B Listing
summary:
- CoreWeave priced its IPO at $40, opening with a valuation of $14 billion and raising $1.5 billion on Day 1.
- This IPO is the largest AI-related listing to date and the biggest U.S. tech IPO since 2021.
- The company transitioned from Ethereum mining to AI training, securing major investments including a $12 billion deal with OpenAI.
- CoreWeave's stock fell 7% to $37, below its IPO price of $40.
- The stock debuted at $39 and closed at $40 on Mar. 28.
- The IPO is the first AI-focused firm listing in a slow market, originally intended to raise $2.5 billion.
- Offering size was reduced from 49 million shares to 37.5 million due to market conditions.

sources.title: CoreWeave co-founder explains how a closet of crypto-mining GPUs led to a $1.5B IPO
Nvidia-backed AI firm’s stock falls 7% below IPO price to $37

title: Australian software firm appoints directors for compliance
summary:
- WiseTech Global has appointed Chris Charlton and Andrew Harrison as independent non-executive directors to its board.
- The appointments restore compliance with exchange regulations for its audit and risk committee.
- This follows a breach of listing rules due to the departure of four independent non-executive directors, including former Chairman Richard Dammery, occurring after the company's half-year results in February.

sources.title: Australian software firm appoints directors for compliance

title: Swedish EV battery firm Northvolt cuts workforce to 1,700
summary:
- Northvolt AB is in bankruptcy, reducing its workforce from 7,000 to 1,700 employees.
- Operations have been scaled back to facilitate a potential sale of the business.
- The company recently put its assets up for sale under court direction.
- Founded in 2016, Northvolt raised around US$10 billion but faced significant operational challenges and rising liabilities.

sources.title: Swedish EV battery firm Northvolt cuts workforce to 1,700

title: Israeli foodtech startup PoLoPo develops potato-based egg protein
summary:
- PoLoPo is developing plant-based technology to produce egg proteins using genetically engineered potatoes.
- The startup has completed its first field trial, yielding five tons of protein-rich potatoes.
- It generates several hundred grams of protein samples monthly for initial collaborations with food companies.
- The company aims to create a stable egg protein supply to reduce disruptions like bird flu outbreaks.
- PoLoPo plans to expand to the US, with its first field trial scheduled for 2026.

sources.title: Israeli foodtech startup PoLoPo develops potato-based egg protein

title: NFT marketplace X2Y2 to shut down by April 2025
summary:
- X2Y2, an NFT marketplace launched in February 2022, will shut down on April 30, 2025.
- Announcement made by pseudonymous founder TP in a blog post.
- Shutdown follows declining trading volumes and competition from platforms like Blur.
- X2Y2's peak monthly trading volume was US$209 million in May 2022.
- The NFT market has experienced a 90% drop in overall trading since 2021.
- X2Y2's smart contracts will remain active post-shutdown, allowing user interaction.

sources.title: NFT marketplace X2Y2 to shut down by April 2025

title: US AI Chipmaker Cerebras Systems Faces IPO Delays Over Security Review
summary:
- Cerebras Systems’ IPO is delayed due to a prolonged national security review.
- Originally filed for IPO in September 2024, expecting easier review with the new Trump administration.
- National security concerns arose from a $335 million investment from Abu Dhabi-based G42, linked to Huawei.
- White House vacancies affect oversight of the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States, causing delays.
- Cerebras Systems Inc. resolved issues with CFIUS, clearing a hurdle for IPO plans.
- The review focused on ties to Abu Dhabi-based G42, which accounted for over 80% of revenue.
- The deal was modified to limit G42 to non-voting shares to avoid further scrutiny.
- Restrictions on AI investments from the Middle East have tightened due to national security concerns.
- Cerebras’ partnership with G42 established data centers in California, Texas, and Minnesota.
- G42 contributed 87% of revenue in early 2024, necessitating US government approval for part of the business.
- Reports suggest the IPO could raise up to US$1 billion, valuing the company at US$7 billion to US$8 billion.

sources.title: Cerebras Systems’ IPO is further delayed
US AI chipmaker secures approval on UAE ties ahead of IPO

title: Indian edtech firm PlanetSpark achieves cash-flow positivity
summary:
- PlanetSpark, backed by Flipkart co-founder Binny Bansal, achieved cash-flow positivity in FY25.
- The startup focuses on teaching communication skills to children and professionals.
- Losses reduced by 70% from 89.5 crore rupees (US$10.5 million) in FY23 to 26.6 crore rupees (US$3.1 million) in FY24.
- Revenue grew 60% year-on-year to 67 crore rupees (US$7.8 million).
- Growth attributed to cost-cutting, customer referrals, and in-house content production.
- AI adoption enabled personalized learning, automated scoring, and improved content delivery.

sources.title: Indian edtech firm PlanetSpark achieves cash-flow positivity

title: Baidu’s Apollo Go, UAE mobility firm partner for driverless fleet
summary:
- Baidu’s Apollo Go partners with UAE-based Autogo for the largest driverless fleet in Abu Dhabi.
- Initial trials with autonomous vehicles to begin in select areas, aiming for full operations by 2026.
- Partnership ensures regulatory compliance with Abu Dhabi’s Integrated Transport Centre for smart mobility goals.
- Apollo Go, China's largest robotaxi platform, operates in over 10 cities and has a pilot license in Hong Kong.
- Service has completed 150 million kilometers and 10 million rides globally, promoting all-electric transport and reducing emissions.

sources.title: Baidu’s Apollo Go, UAE mobility firm partner for driverless fleet

title: TSMC to add 7,000 tech jobs with new chip plant in Taiwan
summary:
- Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC) is creating 7,000 new technology jobs with a fabrication plant in Kaohsiung, Taiwan.
- The facility will produce advanced 2-nanometer chips, with volume production starting in the second half of this year.
- TSMC reaffirms commitment to Taiwan as its core operational base despite global expansion efforts.
- Taiwan Premier Cho Jung-tai emphasizes TSMC’s importance to the national economy and its role as a supplier for companies like Nvidia, Apple, and Qualcomm.
- The new plant aims to address the rising global demand for semiconductors amidst geopolitical concerns.

sources.title: TSMC to add 7,000 tech jobs with new chip plant in Taiwan

title: The Space Race Heats Up: Latest Rocket Launches and News
summary:
- Andoya Spaceport's first orbital launch attempt lasted about 30 seconds before being aborted due to trajectory issues.
- NASA and Boeing are addressing in-flight anomalies of the Starliner spacecraft before its next flight, expected in 2026.
- Katy Perry will join others for Blue Origin's first all-female flight on April 14, 2025, aboard the New Shepard rocket.
- SpaceX Crew-9 and Boeing Starliner astronauts successfully returned to Earth after their respective missions.
- SpaceX's latest Starship flight test ended in failure as the rocket exploded during its eighth test flight.

sources.title: The Space Race Heats Up: Latest Rocket Launches and News

title: Fashion startup CaaStle appears to be in trouble
summary:
- CaaStle, founded in 2011, shifted from a plus-sized clothing subscription service to inventory monetization for retailers in 2018.
- The startup is reportedly facing financial troubles, with CEO Christine Hunsicker resigning and law enforcement investigating alleged financial misconduct.
- CaaStle has almost run out of funds and currently has no open job roles listed on its job board, indicating potential issues.
- The company raised over $530 million since its inception, with its last funding round of $43 million occurring in 2019.
- Experts suggest that 2025 is likely to be a challenging year for startups, aligning with CaaStle's struggles.

sources.title: Fashion startup CaaStle appears to be in trouble

title: This brain-computer interface allowed a stroke survivor to speak after 18 years
summary:
- Scientists developed a brain-computer interface (BCI) that translates thoughts into spoken words in real time.
- The device was tested on a 47-year-old woman with quadriplegia, who had not spoken for 18 years due to a stroke.
- During the clinical trial, the BCI converts her intent to speak into fluent sentences, demonstrating a significant advancement in speech technology for those unable to speak.

sources.title: This brain-computer interface allowed a stroke survivor to speak after 18 years

title: Robot vacuums are getting upgraded support for Apple Home
summary:
- Apple's iOS 18.4 update includes support for robot vacuums in the Apple Home app via the Matter protocol.
- Companies like Roborock, iRobot, and Ecovacs are releasing firmware updates for enhanced compatibility.
- Notable Roborock models receiving updates include the S8 MaxV Ultra and Saros series, scheduled for firmware release between April 1st and 10th.
- iRobot's Roomba Combo 10 Max will be the first compliant with Matter and Apple Home, enabling control through the Home app and Siri.
- Ecovacs is rolling out Matter 1.4 firmware updates for models like Deebot X2 starting today, with phased availability.
- Original announcement for support of robot vacuums in Apple Home was made during WWDC 2024.

sources.title: Robot vacuums are getting upgraded support for Apple Home

title: Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama Join Bluesky, a New Social Media Platform
summary:
- Barack Obama has joined Bluesky, a social network alternative to X (formerly Twitter).
- His account was confirmed by Bluesky OOO Rose Wang.
- Obama celebrated the 15th anniversary of the Affordable Care Act in his initial posts.
- He has a significant following on platforms like X (130.6 million followers) and Facebook (55 million followers).
- Bluesky has gained over 33 million users, benefiting from the exodus of users from X after the 2024 U.S. elections.
- Other notable politicians on Bluesky include Bernie Sanders, Elizabeth Warren, and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez.

- Former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton has joined Bluesky, following former president Barack Obama.
- Clinton confirmed her account’s legitimacy via an Instagram story and a post on X.
- In her introductory post, she focused on the Wisconsin Supreme Court election, highlighting its unprecedented attention and political implications.
- Elon Musk has invested heavily in Republican candidate Brad Schimel’s campaign for the Wisconsin judicial race.
- Bluesky is gaining traction as an alternative to Twitter as high-profile users join, increasing its legitimacy.

sources.title: Barack Obama joins Bluesky
Hillary Clinton joins Bluesky

title: Microsoft expands AI features across Intel and AMD-powered Copilot Plus PCs
summary:
- Microsoft releases AI features on Copilot Plus PCs with Intel and AMD chips.
- Key feature: Live Captions translates audio to English subtitles in real time.
- Live Captions available from latest Windows 11 update.
- New tool Cocreator in Paint generates images based on text descriptions.
- Access to AI image editor and generator in the Photos app is expanded.

- Ongoing testing of the Recall feature for searching screenshots from activities.

title: OpenAI plans to release a new ‘open’ AI language model in the coming months
summary:
- OpenAI intends to release its first open language model since [GPT-2](https://techcrunch.com/2019/02/17/openai-text-generator-dangerous/) in the coming months.
- The company published a [feedback form](https://openai.com/open-model-feedback/) for developers and researchers to provide input on the open-weight model.
- OpenAI plans to host developer events to gather feedback, with the first event scheduled in San Francisco in the coming weeks, followed by events in Europe and Asia-Pacific.
- OpenAI faces pressure from competitors like DeepSeek and Meta, which have adopted successful open model strategies.
- CEO Sam Altman acknowledged the need for a different open-source strategy and discussed plans for model reasoning capabilities resembling OpenAI's o3-mini.
- The company aims to evaluate the model according to its preparedness framework before release, anticipating modifications post-release.

sources.title: OpenAI plans to release a new ‘open’ AI language model in the coming months

title: SwitchBot’s smart button pusher is 30 percent off for Amazon’s Big Spring Sale
summary:
- The SwitchBot Bot is on sale for $20.99 (originally $29.99) using promo code BKLP15 or $22.49 on Amazon.
- It automates devices with buttons, including garage doors, light switches, and appliances.
- Supports voice commands via Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, and Siri when paired with a SwitchBot hub.
- Does not work on toggle switches and requires a separate hub for remote control.
- The SwitchBot Hub Mini is also on sale for $27.99.

title: Amazon Launches Nova Act, an AI Shopping Agent
summary:
- Amazon has introduced **Nova Act**, a new AI model for online shopping tasks, currently in research preview for developers.
- The AI can perform web searches, make purchases, and follow detailed instructions to enhance shopping experiences.
- Part of Amazon's **Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) Labs**, aimed at managing complex tasks to boost business productivity.
- Nova Act is the first product from the Nova series announced in December 2024, focusing on speed and cost-effectiveness.
- Amazon is improving access to AI models via a new website for developers, replacing the previous Amazon Bedrock access.
- The agent can execute tasks like apartment searching and avoiding upsells without supervision.
- Nova Act's capabilities include generating text and images, making it versatile for various online shopping needs.

sources.title: Amazon’s new AI agent is designed to do your shopping
Amazon unveils Nova Act, an AI agent that can shop for you

title: Investments in AI Data Center Chipmaker Retym and Agentic AI Expansion at Temporal
summary:
- Seattle-based [Temporal](https://temporal.io/) raised $146 million to expand into AI and agentic AI microservices.
- The funding round was led by Tiger Global, bringing total funding to $350 million and increasing valuation to $1.72 billion.
- Temporal’s platform has seen a 4.4x revenue increase with 183,000 active users.
- Retym has raised $75 million in Series D funding, totaling $180 million to date.
- The round was led by Spark Capital, aiming to enhance data center communication with a new DSP chip to compete with larger firms.
- Retym targets the communication demands of data centers amid AI growth, without directly processing AI workloads.

sources.title: Temporal lands $146 million at a flat valuation, eyes agentic AI expansion

title: Oracle under fire for its handling of separate security incidents
summary:
- Oracle is criticized for its handling of two separate data breaches.
- One breach involves Oracle Health, affecting patient data from healthcare providers.
- Oracle reportedly notified customers about a breach occurring around February 20, 2025.
- The second breach involves Oracle Cloud, where a hacker claims to have data on 6 million customers.
- Oracle denied a breach but customers confirmed the authenticity of some stolen data.
- Cybersecurity experts call for transparency and accountability from Oracle regarding the breaches.

sources.title: Oracle under fire for its handling of separate security incidents

- Update includes expanded Matter support for better smart device control via Apple Home.
- New features encompass AI-generated review summaries on the App Store, new shortcut actions, and Apple Intelligence support for iPhone 15 Pro.

- Update introduces new emojis and enhances child safety features.

summary:
- Apple announced the rollout of visionOS 2.4, introducing AI features to the Vision Pro.
- New tools include text rewriting, proofreading, summarization, and AI-generated images and emojis.
- Users can perform natural language searches in Photos and create themed "Memory Movies."
- The update also features Priority Messages, Mail Summaries, and Notification management.
- Apple launches the Spatial Gallery app for immersive content experiences.
- The Apple Vision Pro app for iPhone enhances user interaction with the Vision Pro device.
- Apple Intelligence access is expanding to the EU with support for additional languages.

title: iOS 18.4 is out now with Apple Intelligence-powered priority notifications
summary:
- iOS 18.4 introduces priority notifications utilizing Apple Intelligence to highlight important alerts.
- Notifications are prioritized and appear at the top of the notification stack on the Home Screen.
- The update expands Apple Intelligence language support to French, German, Italian, Portuguese (Brazil), Spanish, Japanese, Korean, Chinese (simplified), as well as localized English for Singapore and India.
- Available now on Vision Pro as part of visionOS 2.4, introducing a Vision Pro app for iOS to assist users in finding headset content.
- Additional features include a recipes section for News Plus subscribers and several enhancements to Photos.

title: Plex Launches Revamped Mobile App with Enhanced Features
summary:
- Plex released an updated version of its mobile app on March 31, 2025.
- The redesign features a new user experience, reorganized navigation, and a dedicated Watchlist section.
- Enhanced media features include richer title artwork and revamped detail pages for movies and shows.
- A TV platform update will follow the mobile app revamp.
- Users can personalize their experience with favorites and improved media library tabs.
- The Watchlist feature is now more accessible in the navigation menu.
- The app is rolling out to Android and iOS devices within a week.
- New navigation system, Watchlist button, and improved artwork for shows and movies are included.
- Improvements in load times, scrolling, sleep timer, and picture-in-picture support.
- Future updates will enable downloading entire seasons, casting to more devices, and revised UI for ratings and reviews.
- Plex Pass subscription price increases to $6.99 starting April 29th, with remote playback requiring a subscription.

title: Blue Origin prepping second New Glenn launch in ‘late spring’
summary:
- Blue Origin is preparing for a second launch of the New Glenn rocket in late spring 2025.
- The company has identified seven corrective actions following the booster stage failure during the inaugural flight in January.
- New Glenn is designed to reach orbit and aims to compete with SpaceX in the launch market.

sources.title: Blue Origin prepping second New Glenn launch in ‘late spring’

title: API Testing Firm APIsec Exposed Customer Data During Security Lapse
summary:
- API testing firm APIsec confirmed a security lapse exposing an internal database of customer data for several days.
- The exposed database contained names and email addresses of employees from APIsec's clients and security posture details.
- UpGuard discovered the exposed database on March 5 and reported it the same day; APIsec secured it soon after.
- APIsec's founder initially claimed the data was only 'test data' but later acknowledged the presence of real customer data.
- The database also contained sensitive information such as AWS keys and other credentials, but APIsec claimed they were linked to a former employee.

sources.title: API Testing Firm APIsec Exposed Customer Data During Security Lapse

title: Signal sees its downloads double after scandal
summary:
- Signal app downloads doubled following the messaging scandal involving the Trump administration.
- Downloads spiked by 26% on the day the news broke, reaching 195,000 by the following Wednesday.
- Average daily downloads for Signal are around 95,000, indicating a significant increase in interest due to the scandal.

sources.title: Signal sees its downloads double after scandal

title: Apple Faces $162 Million Fine for Complex Privacy Options Impacting Small Developers
summary:
- France's competition watchdog fined Apple €150 million (~$162.4 million) for its App Tracking Transparency system, which was deemed harmful to small publishers.
- The system, launched in 2021, requires two pop-ups for user tracking permission, while location tracking for Apple's apps requires only one tap.
- The French authority argues the initiative makes third-party app usage excessively complex compared to Apple apps, impacting revenue for companies like Snapchat and Facebook by nearly $10 billion.
- This is the first fine by any antitrust regulator regarding Apple’s App Tracking Transparency (ATT) tool.
- The fine follows a 1.8 billion euro penalty imposed on Apple by the EU for anti-competitive practices in the music streaming sector.
- The head of the French Competition Authority stated that the decision was made without political influence, amidst potential threats from U.S. officials regarding fines.

sources.title: Apple fined $162 million for hurting app developers with ‘excessively complex’ privacy options
Apple faces a $162 million fine from French regulators. Here’s why

title: Amazon Launches Early Access for Alexa Plus with Limited Features
summary:
- Alexa Plus, a new AI-powered voice assistant, will be available on Echo devices in the coming weeks.
- Available on Echo Show 8, 10, 15, and 21, Fire TV devices, Fire tablets, and the web, but not on older Echo devices.
- Users can sign up for early access via the [Alexa Plus landing page](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0DCCNHWV5?tag=theverge02-20).
- Free during early access; will eventually require a $19.99/month subscription or Amazon Prime.
- Alexa Plus can process multiple commands and understand natural language, responding to user emotion.
- Not all existing Alexa skills will be available at launch, leading to potential loss of favorite skills.
- The service lacks advertised features like budgeting gift ideas and grocery ordering.
- Currently available only on Echo Show 8, 10, 15, and 21 devices, with capabilities like ordering Uber and document summarization.
- Features are expected to be launched in waves over time with ongoing improvements planned.

sources.title: Alexa Plus is coming to almost every Echo — but your favorite skill might not make the cut
Alexa Plus just launched in early access, but it’s missing some features

title: Granite Asia, Japan’s Integral Corporation form joint venture
summary:
- Granite Asia and Japan's Integral Corporation announced a joint venture named Granite-Integral on Mar. 31, focusing on cross-border investments in Japan.
- The initiative has an initial capital commitment of US$100 million, with equal contributions from both companies.
- The venture aims to support high-growth tech companies entering Japan and assist Japanese firms in expanding into Southeast Asia and other growth markets.
- Integral’s tech-focused investment arm will play a significant role in the joint venture, addressing regulatory and cultural challenges for global tech companies in Japan.
- Granite-Integral will be co-led by CK Choun and Joe Yan, both experienced in cross-border investments and technology scaling.
- Granite Asia manages US$5 billion in assets and is based in Singapore, while Integral Corporation is a Tokyo-listed private equity firm.

sources.title: Granite Asia, Japan’s Integral Corporation form joint venture

- This rebranding follows the announcement of Max's availability in Australia.

title: Runway Unveils Advanced Video-Generating AI Model and Reid Hoffman's Insights on AI's Role
summary:
- Reid Hoffman discusses AI's potential in his book 'Superagency', calling it an 'intelligence amplifier'.
- He foresees a 'cognitive Industrial Revolution' while acknowledging potential job losses.
- Hoffman differentiates between beneficial AI tools and harmful technologies, urging adaptation over fear.
- He emphasizes the importance of governance in AI, advocating for democratic leadership in the cognitive revolution.
- Hoffman stresses the need for fact-checking and transparency in AI to avoid bias.
- AI startup Runway launched Gen-4, a high-fidelity video generator, on March 31, 2025.
- Gen-4 can create consistent characters and environments without extensive fine-tuning.
- Runway, supported by Salesforce and Google, faces competition in the video space, amid a lawsuit over copyright claims.
- A study indicates a potential reduction of over 100,000 U.S. entertainment jobs due to AI by 2026.

sources.title: Reid Hoffman: ‘Start using AI deeply. It is a huge intelligence amplifier’
Runway releases an impressive new video-generating AI model

title: U.S. seeks to ramp up social media data collection. Here’s what to know about Homeland Security’s plans
summary:
- The Department of Homeland Security plans to collect social media handles from individuals applying for immigration benefits to comply with an executive order from President Trump.
- This initiative has raised concerns among immigration and free speech advocates, as it extends surveillance to individuals already legally in the U.S.
- The proposal is open for public comments until May 5, and could impact approximately 3.6 million people.
- The U.S. government has been using social media for immigration vetting since 2014, with growing scrutiny over its implications for privacy and free speech.

sources.title: U.S. seeks to ramp up social media data collection. Here’s what to know about Homeland Security’s plans

title: CEO Matt Bromberg on ending Unity’s ‘war’ against its customers
summary:
- Matt Bromberg, CEO of Unity, discusses changes he implemented after joining the company amid customer dissatisfaction and turmoil.
- Bromberg highlights the importance of Unity in the gaming ecosystem, powering many mobile and independent games.
- The previous pricing model change, known as the runtime fee, led to severe backlash and the resignation of the former CEO, John Riccitiello.
- Bromberg chose to scrap the runtime fee, seeing it as crucial for Unity's future success.
- He talks about Unity's current focus and growth opportunities outside gaming, including applications in automotive and other industries.

- Ketchup plans to release the film, directed by Dave Green, in theaters in 2026.
- The film had been shelved in 2023 for a $30 million tax write-off; Warner Bros. had rejected other offers from Amazon, Netflix, and Paramount.

summary:

- Discussions include joining other non-Chinese shareholders like Susquehanna International Group and General Atlantic.
- The goal is to reduce Chinese ownership in TikTok’s US business to below 20% for compliance with US regulations.
- President Trump stated a deal with ByteDance will be finalized before the April 5 deadline.
- Significant interest from potential buyers for TikTok has been noted.
- The original deadline to ban TikTok was extended to April 5 following an executive order in January.

title: BYD denies report of Indian EV plant investment while planning $10 billion factory
summary:
- BYD plans to invest US$10 billion in a facility near Hyderabad, Telangana.
- The new plant will manufacture battery systems and electric vehicles, targeting an annual production capacity of 600,000 EVs by 2032.
- Includes a battery unit with a 20 GWh annual capacity, marking BYD's first factory in India.
- This investment is part of India's growing attraction for global EV manufacturers.
- India recorded over 1.9 million EV registrations in 2024 supported by reduced import duties.
- BYD has denied claims of establishing a manufacturing plant in India, labeling the reports “untrue.”

summary:
- Manus AI launches two subscription plans starting at $39 per month.
- The lower-cost plan includes 3,900 credits and allows running two tasks simultaneously, while the premium plan offers 19,900 credits and five simultaneous tasks for $199 per month.

title: NASA and Boeing Address Starliner Issues Before Next Crewed Flight
summary:
- Sunita Williams and Barry Wilmore returned to Earth after a nine-month stay on the ISS due to Boeing Starliner's issues.
- They splashed down in the Gulf of Mexico in a SpaceX Dragon capsule after a 17-hour return journey.
- The mission duration was extended because of leaks and thruster problems with the Starliner spacecraft.
- Initially launched in June 2024, the mission aimed to assist Boeing in competing with SpaceX's crewed flights.
- NASA and SpaceX coordinated an early return for the astronauts in 2025 to avoid short-staffing the ISS.
- Elon Musk claimed he offered to bring them home sooner, which was disputed by former NASA officials.
- NASA and Boeing are resolving technical issues in the Starliner before its next flight, expected in late 2025 or early 2026.
- Anomalies in the Starliner's thruster, valve, and helium systems delayed astronaut returns.
- Current efforts include postflight data analysis and testing of thrusters and helium system seals.

title: Leaked chat logs reveal details of the Black Basta ransomware group's operations and a recent network breach.
summary:

- Attackers employed advanced techniques like DLL sideloading and PowerShell for rapid lateral movement.

- Disagreements on targeting a Russian bank increased law enforcement scrutiny risks.
- The leak provided information on administrators and over 350 unique links from ZoomInfo for targeting.

title: Gemini hackers can deliver more potent attacks with a helping hand from… Gemini
summary:
- New attacks on Gemini use indirect prompt injection to exploit vulnerabilities in large language models.
- Researchers have developed a method called 'Fun-Tuning' for creating effective prompt injections against closed-weights models like Gemini, increasing success rates significantly.
- Fun-Tuning requires approximately 60 hours of compute time but only costs about $10 due to free access to the Gemini fine-tuning API.
- Attack success rates for Fun-Tuning were 65% against Gemini 1.5 Flash and 82% against Gemini 1.0 Pro, compared to baseline rates of 28% and 43%, respectively.
- The methodology allows attackers to algorithmically optimize prompt injections using discrete optimization techniques, which were typically labor-intensive if done manually.

title: Satya Nadella: DeepSeek is the new bar for Microsoft’s AI success + Drama over quantum computing’s future heats up
summary:
- On March 18, Chetan Nayak of Microsoft presented quantum chip data at the American Physical Society summit amid ongoing skepticism.
- Microsoft claims a new topological qubit is less prone to errors, but researchers are doubtful of the evidence.
- Controversy stems from Microsoft's past retraction of similar claims and concerns over the timeline for useful quantum computing applications.
- Experts predict a decade before quantum computers become useful for practical applications, with current research focusing on reducing errors and scaling up qubits.
- Governments and private sectors are investing heavily in quantum technology, but overhype risks a potential 'quantum winter' due to inflated expectations.

- Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella deployed DeepSeek’s R1 on Azure in January, setting a new benchmark for AI success.
- Nadella highlighted the efficiency of DeepSeek, which operates with a small team and optimized Nvidia's CUDA layer.
- Despite heavy investments and advertising, Microsoft's Copilot app has not achieved comparable success to ChatGPT in the App Store.
- The company is investing $80 billion in AI and data centers to support its AI-focused engineering groups.
- Microsoft aims for every workload to resemble ChatGPT in complexity and performance, while addressing sustainability in its practices.
- Microsoft believes AI can aid in achieving its carbon-negative goal by 2030, despite critics questioning its feasibility.

sources.title: Drama over quantum computing’s future heats up

title: The Implications of 23andMe's Bankruptcy and Health Information Reliability
summary:

- Customers encouraged to motivate family and friends to take protective measures for their data.

- The health information provided by 23andMe is largely deemed unreliable for diagnosing medical conditions.

title: Meta's Settlement with Tanya O’Carroll: A Landmark Case for Data Privacy Rights
summary:

- The case may empower UK citizens to assert their data rights against social media.

- Future government influence and policy changes could challenge data protection effectiveness.

- This follows Foxconn's agreement with Mitsubishi Motors to produce EVs for Oceania, marking its first outsourcing deal with a Japanese automaker in response to competition from Chinese EV firms.

title: Alibaba open-sources multimodal AI Qwen2.5-Omni-7B
summary:
- Alibaba has released Qwen2.5-Omni-7B, its first multimodal LLM that processes text, images, audio, and video simultaneously.
- The model generates outputs in both text and natural-sounding speech in real time.
- In benchmark tests like OmniBench, it outperformed models such as Google’s Gemini 1.5 Pro.
- Qwen2.5-Omni-7B can interpret multiple sensory inputs and respond to complex tasks effectively.

title: Kim Jong Un tests AI suicide drones for military modernization
summary:

- State media emphasized the significance of unmanned systems and AI in arms development.
- Upgraded reconnaissance drones can detect tactical targets and monitor enemy activities.
- North Korea revealed an airborne early-warning aircraft for the first time.
- Kim highlighted the necessity of unmanned equipment and AI for military modernization.

sources.title: Kim Jong Un tests AI suicide drones for military modernization

title: Trump Considers Reducing Tariffs on China for TikTok Deal as Public Support for Ban Declines
summary:
- A [Pew Research Center](https://www.pewresearch.org/short-reads/2025/03/25/fewer-americans-now-support-tiktok-ban-see-the-platform-as-a-national-security-threat-than-in-spring-2023/?utm_source=AdaptiveMailer&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=25-03-25%20TikTok%20ban%20short%20read&org=982&lvl=100&ite=15726&lea=4249848&ctr=0&par=1&trk=a0DQm0000053vznMAA) study indicates support for a TikTok ban among Americans has decreased from 50% in 2023 to 34% in 2025.
- Opposition to the ban has risen from 22% in 2023 to 32% in the latest survey.
- Support for the ban has dropped significantly across political affiliations, with Republicans at 30% from 60% and Democrats at 30% from 43%.
- TikTok users show lower support for the ban (12%) compared to non-users (45%).
- Bipartisan support remains for the ban due to security concerns, backed by legislation signed by President Biden.
- Donald Trump is proposing to reduce tariffs on China to help facilitate a deal with TikTok’s parent company, ByteDance.
- A deadline is set for April 5 for ByteDance to secure a non-Chinese buyer for TikTok to avoid a ban.
- The US government views ByteDance’s ownership of TikTok as a national security concern because of potential Chinese government influence.

sources.title: The TikTok ban is losing support among Americans, study says
Trump floats easing tariffs on China in return for TikTok deal

title: Blibli and TikTok Shop Report Strong Sales Growth During Ramadan
summary:
- TikTok Shop reported a [40% sales increase](https://www.techinasia.com/news/indonesias-tiktok-shop-reports-40-sales-increase-in-ramadan) during Ramadan 2025 compared to the previous year.
- Announcement made by Melissa Siska Juminto on Mar. 17, 2025, at an event in Jakarta.
- Notable rise in local sellers; TikTok users uploaded 72 million short videos in the first week of Ramadan due to seller activity and promotions.

- Blibli achieved a [14% year-on-year revenue growth](https://www.techinasia.com/news/blibli-posts-14-revenue-growth-2024) for 2024, with a 41% increase in Q4.
- Direct sales grew 66% to 859 billion rupiah (US$51.89 million), marketplace sales increased by 26%.
- Gross profit surged 173% year-on-year; operational take rate rose to 6.9%.
- Expanded logistics network enables two-hour delivery in 48 cities; operates 204 consumer electronics stores, 60 premium supermarkets, and 32 home and living centers.
- Supported by a capital raise of 2.25 trillion rupiah (US$135.93 million), decreasing operating losses by 34%.

summary:

- BYD is expanding in Latin America, Southeast Asia, and Britain, but will not enter the US or Canada due to tariffs.
- New factories are being constructed in Brazil, Thailand, Hungary, and Turkey.
- Overseas markets are expected to be a key driver for BYD's profitability, prompting a planned increase in its software team from 5,000 to 8,000 employees.

summary:

summary:
- StubHub has filed for an IPO on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol “STUB”.
- The company reported a net loss of US$2.8 million on US$1.77 billion in revenue for 2024, a drop from a US$405 million profit in 2023.

- The IPO market is recovering with new filings despite previous sluggishness.
- Citigroup and Wells Fargo are involved in StubHub’s public listing.
- The IPO filing did not mention co-founder Jeff Fluhr, raising questions about his contributions.
- StubHub remains a significant player in the ticket resale market.

title: Australian superannuation fund sells $580m stake in WiseTech

- CEO RJ Scaringe emphasizes the need for diverse electrified transport options.
